page.title: 17The Village School.
page.content: The children of Hemyock attend the Primary school in the village from the age of five until the age of eleven, when they transfer to Uffculme Comprehensive School. Hemyock County Primary is a Devon County Council school. There are one hundred and twenty five pupils at the school, taught by four teachers and the Headmaster, Mr. Roy McQueen. The numbers of boys and girls at the are about equal.The children come from Hemyock, Clayhidon and the surrounding area. Two mini-busses collect children from outlying areas. The school was opened in 1877 but moved to a new building on a new site in 1982. Apart from the teachers there are a secretary, a classroom assistant three cleaners, a driver, two mealtime assistants, three dining centre helpers and a crossing patrol.
